website_summaries.verdict: A timeless watch by one of the most popular names in the industry. Delivers casual looks and accuracy plus a price that's fits almost any budget.
pros: A budget-friendly watch with classic looks and straightforward features
Sports a water-resistant, easy-to-read dial with Indiglo light and date window
cons: Some consumers gripe about difficulties changing the date setting, and some wish that the dial was slightly larger

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very nice watch and completely worth the price. Been a while since I've owned a watch and I wanted something that was very casual yet equally professional. It has a very nice weight to it barely noticeable and a great features is that it doesn't hurt the top of your hand when you left your wrist upward.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar

customer_reviews.title: A great watch for smart people.
customer_reviews.text: Got this on sale - incredible value for the money. Had an almost identical one that lasted a couple of decades. Hope this one does the same. I wouldn't have gotten rid of the old one, but the crystal had gotten scratched and I finally cracked it while changing the battery. In addition to keeping good time and seeming to run on the same battery forever, these watches have a feature you won't find in a $5,000.00 Rolex - no one will crack your skull open or shoot you to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice simple good quality watch - a classic win-win.
customer_reviews.text: The watch is amazing, just what I expected from them - really easy readable clock face, classic design which fits both the T-shirts during your working week and casual style on a weekend. It's been a week - and the watch shows the time very precisely, second by second comparing with a laptop's clock. I love also the brand Indiglo backlight which unobtrusively helps you read the indications in a darkness. I am totallysatisfied with my purchase, it is definitely worth its price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you want a good watch, buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: Can't give it a 5, because it is hard to LOVE a watch. I have had the same model watch for about 8 years and it works flawlessly. I replaced the battery once and the band twice. The band on my old one finally wore out again and I decided to get another new watch. I like the fact that it has hands so it is easier to read the time and I truly like the Indiglo feature that lights the dial when you push the stem. This will be my choice of watch....until they quit making this reliable piece.
customer_reviews.author: Photo Jack

customer_reviews.title: Review--Cut 2
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch and band to replace an older version of the same design and features. The old watch is still working fine, but the strap broke. I decided to purchase the watch to get the band that I needed. Love that Indiglo! Update April 2018: This watch quit working eight months after I bought it in July 2017. Timex 1-yr warranty is not worth time and expense of filing a claim, so I bore the loss on that watch. Two weeks ago, I bought a third version of this same watch. This latest watch was defective upon arrival in that day/date could not be set using the stem. I returned it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: bcb

customer_reviews.title: I Truly Love My TIMEX T2H281
customer_reviews.text: My newly purchased Timex Men's T2H281 is without doubt my favourite time piece ever. At less than $20 my T2H281 came well equipped with a lovely genuine black leather band, stylish circular stainless steel structural framework and, most importantly, exceedingly accurate time keeping mechanical technology. I truly respect the social status associated with my far more expensive Longines, Tag Heuer, Tissot and Rolex, but the time piece I will be wearing on my left wrist everyday will be my Timex; the other time pieces are now officially intergenerational transfers for my scion.
customer_reviews.author: J Nemorin

customer_reviews.title: Five stars despite minor problem
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch as an everyday casual timepiece. Despite the five star rating, I changed the leather band to a stainless link bracelet type (just my preference) and I also had an issue with the date/time setting feature. After a short month I wanted to advance the date to the 1st and couldn't find the right position for the stem to move the date. I pulled too hard and the stem came completely out! It was re-inserted without a problem, but I suspect it doesn't help with the water resistance. Other than that, I am fully satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn7175

customer_reviews.title: Can't say enough; Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth one of these. None of them stopped working and those 4 got me through 40 or more years of rough treatment. Average 10 years each before I broke the crystal during some rough treatment or lost it. I replaced bands on all of them after 6 years or so but never had to replace a battery and never lost or gained time. Night light a real plus for me and I have submerged all of them many times. You will not cry and spend days looking if you lose this or break it as it is sooooooooo inexpensive. Can't say enough about this product and never trust a review by someone who got a deal.
customer_reviews.author: john c. hardwicke

customer_reviews.title: 00 AND SO FAR WORKS GREAT. WHY SPEND MORE
customer_reviews.text: GOT MY 1ST TIMEX IN 1961 FOR MY 14TH BIRTHDAY. MY AUNT PAID $10.00. I WORE IT THROUGH COLLEGE AND THEN THE ARMY DURING THE VIETNAM WAR, AND UNTIL MY 40TH BIRTHDAY WHEN MY WIFE BOUGHT ME A $250. 00 SEIKO WHICH DIED LAST WEEK. SEIKO NO LONGER HAS PARTS FOR IT SO IT'S NOW WORTHLESS. THE NEW TIMEX COST ME LESS THAN $19.00 AND SO FAR WORKS GREAT. WHY SPEND MORE? AMERICANS ARE TOO BRAND CONSCIOUS FOR SILLY REASONS. I CAN STILL HEAR JOHN CAMERON SWAZEE TYING A TIMEX TO AN OUTBOARD MOTOR AND PUTTING THE WATCH TO HIS EAR SAYING "IT TOOK A LICKING AND KEEPS ON TICKING".
customer_reviews.author: tony from Philly

customer_reviews.title: Great watch, too small for me
customer_reviews.text: Im giving it 5 stars because it deserves it, it really is a good lookibg watch, but its too small. I dont like huge watches, but Im a guy. This watch would be a great girls' watch I think. Or, maybe a guys' if youre into smaller watches. If youre into normal sized watches, or especially large watches, you wont like this. I hated having to return it but it just wasnt big enough. It really lools good. Image is a comparison with a watch that would be considered normal sized by many, maybe small by guys who like big watches
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: I love the watch face
customer_reviews.text: Looks as it does in the picture, maybe a bit smaller. I love the watch face! I only have two reservations thus far: 1. It came with a couple scratches on the rim, I hope that's the only thing that missed quality control. 2. If you want to change the day, you have to wind the clock the whole way to get there. This isn't really a big deal though.
customer_reviews.author: Zander Willoughby

customer_reviews.title: Piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: After two months the watch ran slow, losing one minute every hour. When i called for service, they told me to change the date and move the hands . This fix did not work. Instead of sending a new watch, they want me to send it back for repair. Timex is cheap for a reason. It doesn't work. I felt they should send me a new watch and a return mail box or envelope. Very disappointed in the product and the company. Avoid this product like the plague.
customer_reviews.author: ontheway

customer_reviews.title: A simply basic watch and that is all that I wanted.  I am happy.
customer_reviews.text: It is a basic easy to see and use watch. I did not want a watch with all of the expensive bells and whistles that the expensive watches. I needed a simply everyday watch and that is exactly what they sent to me. I wanted a watch that could take a licking nd still be ti ckicking. That is exactly what they sent to me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Ladies, too!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with my fellow Jane reviewer. This is a classy, elegant watch which is ideal for women if you change out the strap to something more feminine. I ordered the Hadley-Roma 18 mm black lambskin strapto go with it and it fits *perfectly*. It is now an elegant, feminine looking watch with a face that is large enough to see without reading glasses. Love It! If you're looking for a "larger face" watch that is more dressy than the Timex Weekender, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: JanieO

customer_reviews.title: A very simple and plain functional watch.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure it was going to keep working when I first started using it, as it kept stopping. I had to keep fooling with the stem, pulling it out and pushing it back in numerous times before it finally kept running. It has not stopped for the last 5 days, so I hope it will continue. I really like the simplicity, the large dial and you can Push in the stem to light up the face for viewing at night. If I hadn't had the initial problem, I would have rated it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Barb

customer_reviews.title: About as simple as they make them, and everything I need ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this basic Timex, no frills, no extra functions ... it doesn't tell me if my car needs gas but it does tell the time and date simply and I can read it at any time of night or day. The numbers are big enough to be seen even without my glasses, and it lights up if it is dark. Easy peasy. I have an iWatch, but it drives me crazy - features are too small to see and the keys too small to manipulate. I found that I really just wanted a watch that tells the time simply. This is it, this is the one! Simplicity itself! Patrick Linehan, Washington, DC
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Linehan

customer_reviews.title: It's heavy and runs slow
customer_reviews.text: Timex is no longer an affordable quality watch. It's heavy, the time isn't consistent (seems to loose about 1/2 a minute a day) & it was all around a bad buy. I leave it on my desk as a clock and update the time weekly - will never put it on my wrist again. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great for those analog users that want day and date at a glance!
customer_reviews.text: This one shows both day and date -- super! Getting the initial setup for date and time can be tricky. Not much distance on the pull out stem. This is a replacement to my old watch, so I knew that going in to it. But once you have the time, day, and date aligned it's a great device to have. This is not an auto reset date, so you have to keep up with monthly day changes, but a small price to pay to see the time (and day/date combination) clearly with big numerals. Indiglo feature is great for night time conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Joel from TX

customer_reviews.title: Cheap watch. Date to small for this old man eyes.
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Date field is to small and hard to set the date. NOTE: Plastic envelope ok. Watch case inside smashed as if some one jumped on the item! It is not a high end watch. But looks good enough to wear with a casual outfit and I plan to wear with suit! Old men rules and it's fine for my use. Buy it. Don't complain as it's a watch period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WATCH FOR ME ---
customer_reviews.text: I have five watches. One from my wife, one from my daughter, one from my employer, one from the famous hotel in Quebec and an old Timex that I have taken around the world in the past 20 years. So I was sitting here thinking it's my 80th birthday and what do I want for myself. So I got myself a new Timex for dress. I love it because I can read the time well day or night. I will give some of the others away but maybe not. My kids do not want watches. Sounds stupid to me. But I am happy with my gift to myself. A+++++++can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra K Martin

customer_reviews.title: Love the face easy to read
customer_reviews.text: We just bought six Times watches from Amazon. Two ladies and four mens watches. We needed batteries for existing Timex's and due to the virus decided not to visit brick and mortar at this time. The band on this one is very stiff. I suggest you be prepared to have the band replaced should you chose to do so. We will with a blsck flex band. With that exception it's a great watch. I could not justify taking off a star for a band. I knew the band was stiff from the Q&A. It's definitely a five star product. Enjoy this one. It's a good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Love this watch
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd watch of this kind that I have. I cracked the previous one's glass due to my own fault, and chose to replace than repair. I replaced the band with a metal one and am extremely pleased with the outcome. The light is great to check the time when waking up at night, (the main reason for me buying this particular watch) . The dial is clear to read day or night. The only fault is the size of the date window which is too small for my eyes, and definite is useless at night.
customer_reviews.author: dg

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves this watch!
customer_reviews.text: This was an exact replacement for my husband's beloved watch, but since the lost watch showed up the day this one arrived in the mail, we had to return it. But I thought I would write a review, anyway, because my husband loves it so. It keeps perfect time (and he's a stickler for keeping time within milliseconds), the Indiglo works beautifully, and it's a good, sturdy, no-nonsense watch. Timex is still a quality company. (No, they didn't pay me for this, but I have a ladies Timex Indiglo and I love it, too.)
customer_reviews.author: Good Gracia

customer_reviews.title: After 3 years, slowing down
customer_reviews.text: Bought this watch a little over 3 years ago. Affordable, classic, functional, usable, beautiful. Unfortunately in recent days I've noticed it slowing down. I adjusted it, but within a day or two it was behind a couple minutes again. Thought about changing the battery, but from my research, dying batteries shouldn't slow down the watch (it would just stop immediately with a dead battery). So the slowdown may be related to the watch itself, not the battery. Don't want to waste my time and money changing the battery if that's the case. Still worth it probably. A little annoying.
customer_reviews.author: T.Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Paid for new, received someone's return
customer_reviews.text: The watch I received from Amazon Prime LLC appears to be a return, rather than a new watch. It was running and missing the battery keeper clip, as well as the protective plastic crystal protector. The was a yellow piece of paper (with ad) behind the watch. I am a bit disappointed that Amazon Prime sent me a return when I paid for a new watch. Otherwise the watch seem fine, but will check its time keeping and return if defective. Update: The watch keeps excellent time, so I will keep it. I would rate the watch five stars, but deducted a star for receiving a return.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Bad seller, mediocre watch
customer_reviews.text: I so wanted to like this watch--it appeared perfect online. I don't know if it was there seller, Amazon, or Timex but this arrived broken, and scuffed in a number if places. I ended up not giving it as a gift...If I had known it was going to arrive in this state, I would have just bought it from the store. I don't think there's any chance for a refund, as when I called Timex I was essentially told "not our problem." I cannot recommend this watch given my experience.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob A.

customer_reviews.title: Extremely nice looking dress or casual watch
customer_reviews.text: Extremely nice looking dress or casual watch. Gold plated trim with white face and black numbers and hands, including seconds hand. Good size of watch face to my arm. I think that this would look great on any male 140 pounds or heaver (up to 300lbs). Also has indiglo button that is combined with the single watch stem. With the indiglo feature, the white background of the watch face really makes the watch easily viewable it night and daytime too. This is a verified purchase I do not receive anything for this review.
customer_reviews.author: Gary S.

customer_reviews.title: A Close Second to the 1960's Original
customer_reviews.text: l daughters bought me a similar Timex about 30 years ago and that one outlasted four bands. With my poor close up vision, this watch is perfect to actually tell time. Have always loved the Indiglo feature that allows me to see the time at night. I prefer a plastic band as I like to leave my everyday watch on even when showering and hard yard work. The leather does look much better, so will probably be better for those who do not abuse their watch like I do. I have a number of nice watches (i.e.: expensive) but love this one for what it is: A "Keeps on Ticking" Timex. Price was unbeatable, a real value.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph

customer_reviews.title: good qulaity good price
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the quality, case is gold + polished on all sides, case measures 39mm, band measures 20mm, band is soft leather on top, buckle is gold + stamped "Timex", Great aesthetic quality + appearance, a 10 year battery life is fantastic! Large numerals are very easy to read, Watch is also light weight, I have a few of the 35mm versions with the 18mm std expansion bands but this face/case is larger + looks like a much more expensive + thicker brass gold plated case, looks Terrific, VERY SATISFIED!!! Indiglo lighting works very well! What an Outstanding buy for $30.00 Don't know how they manufacture this quality for such a low cost? Will not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: big enough to see
customer_reviews.text: the price was cheap and it hits all the marks except I wish the date window was bigger. I am a woman and wear mens watches because they are bigger and I can see them. the date window Is just a little too small for good viewing. but for the price, you can't beat it. and I were it all the time doing everything. I don't know about water resistance because I just haven't noticed. but I wash hands and pay no attention to getting water on it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted.  Simple and old fashioned
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for better quality. The band came apart, and luckily I felt the watch fall the ground. A watch band should last longer than this one did. After it came undone spontaneously, I gave up and stored it in my dresser. The tiny holes drilled to hold the band are too shallow. After decades of making watches, Timex, or it's Asian subcontractor mass produced manufacturers should know how to design a watch so it doesn't fall off your wrist.
customer_reviews.author: JJVA

customer_reviews.title: Could not Get start up
customer_reviews.text: Color: Black/Silver-Tone/White Hard to rate- just this one or others too with a crown almost impossible to pull out and the day view window too small to see two-digit dates. Could not get it to run,1 followed all directions on the web site. Tried light activation and manual wind. No tick, no second-hand turn. Sent back - did not ask for a second one. Was going to rate a 3, you know, just this one, but the overall ratings will even this bad one out.
customer_reviews.author: D. HUNT

customer_reviews.title: Reliable large face Indiglo watch
customer_reviews.text: A great watch all around--I never take it off. The movement is quite loud, however, and I joke with my kids that it's reminding me of mortality🤣. I am unsure why Timex thinks this should be marketed strickly to men--anyone with poor vision would be interested in this solid, economical, hardworking watch.
customer_reviews.author: Bibliophile

customer_reviews.title: Faulty Date Adjustment
customer_reviews.text: The date adjustment dial does not work. The instructions tell you to use the dials middle setting to set the date, but then adds that If that doesn’t work,you need to change the date by advancing the time.Each time you turn the time dial,it advances 20 minutes,so go figure how many times you have to turn the dial to advance the date by 17 days! (72 times for each day!) I was going to return it but I had thrown away the packaging.On a positive note I have owned this model three times over the years and I have been extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Dlink

customer_reviews.title: They sent me a woman's watch?
customer_reviews.text: It's like a knock-off brand. Cheaply made, feels cheap, looks tiny, narrow band, band of low quality? WTF? It's a Timex for 30 bucks. Is it too much to ask for a quality watch in that price range? I'll just go to my local CVS pharmacy and pick up their 20 dollar watches (no names) that look and feel (heavy) great. You know what Timex, scrap the $30 model and make it $50 and construct something more commensurate with your time-honored brand; shame on you. Better to make something expensive and great than affordable garbage.
customer_reviews.author: david yepez

customer_reviews.title: I like the appearance of the watch and the back-lit feature
customer_reviews.text: I like the appearance of the watch and the back-lit feature. However, the wrist band is very stiff and difficult to use. The stem control for the time and dates is very imprecise, making it difficult to set the date without spinning the hands. Can be done, after multiple attempts. I don't know how durable the finish of the case will be. If it scratches easily, the contrasting gold color and silver color base metal will be very apparent. We shall see. This is my forth.Timex Indeglo over about 18 years.The first watch was definitely the best of the four.
customer_reviews.author: P M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Read Watch And Fits Large Wrist
customer_reviews.text: This Timex watch is terrific for a large elderly man. After two failed attempts that proved difficult to read and too small in the band, this watch is a winner. The Arabic numerals are easy to read (unlike dots, or dashes), and the black numerals against the white face are a crisp image. The leather adjustable notch band is a comfortable fit for a 235 lb. gentleman with a size 13 ring size. The Timex is easy to read, helps Dad keep track of the date and time, and keeps him looking forward to his next activities of the day.
customer_reviews.author: CeciLafayette

customer_reviews.title: simple, basic watch
customer_reviews.text: Timex is a known brand so there are some expectations that come with that. However, I think this watch is just okay. It's a pretty good deal for a simple watch. The light up feature is nice to have and does help in dark environments. Time accuracy is pretty good but does run fast. Longevity is a question with this watch. Overall, it's a simple, basic watch that doesn't have any frills apart from the light up feature.
customer_reviews.author: Consumerist

customer_reviews.title: Watch stopped within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Have always worn a timex, 40+ years, and increasingly noticed the time fades with their watches in slowness over greater shorter of length of time. The previous to this began loosing minutes within 2+ years so replaced with this one. I wanted a leather band vs stretch but assumed still a Timex so should be ok but only wore from October to early December before it completely stopped. Taking time to explore battery replacement or otherwise should not be on me. Will consider another Timex but also now considering other brands, avenues, exploration, reviews etc.
customer_reviews.author: laura c. dimambro

customer_reviews.title: Love These Watches
customer_reviews.text: I love these and have been buying them for decades. Since getting older I no longer enjoy the digital watches and returned to the analog. The numbers are large and the Indiglo feature is great for use in the dark. Great price too!
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Um for men maybe
customer_reviews.text: Okay overall the quality of this watch was not explored because upon receiving the watch it looked very feminine on my husband. It was quite narrow and reminded me of a watch I used to own frankly. If you’re looking for a smaller or more narrow watch this might be just the one for you!
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Classy but slowly loses time and displays 31 days for each month, leather band broke.  :-(
customer_reviews.text: Pros: -Relatively low price -Great aesthetics and simplicity. Cons: -You have to reset the date regularly because the watch doesn't account for some months have 28 days and others having 31, etc. -The leather loop that the watch band slips through broke so I had to sew it back up myself. This was after about a year of wearing it. -The clock slowly loses time so you have to reset the time regularly too and that kind of negates its effectiveness as a time telling device unfortunately.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous2

customer_reviews.title: Simple minimalist design
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves his watch. He needed something simple that looked professional and practical. We both love minimal accessories and I just ordered the pink one for myself! I do wish that it had a manual on how to set up the date, but thankfully, someone answered that question in the Q&A area. I definitely recommend this watch for people who love simple, clean-looking accessories.
customer_reviews.author: historianis

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my father, who had glaucoma. He wears glasses, but couldn't read his watch anymore. He loved it. Literally every time I spoke with him, he would tell me how much easier it was to tell the time. He liked how big the numbers were and loved the glowing face. It made him feel a lot more independent because he didn't have to ask people what time it was anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these watches for years--before boyfriend watches were the craze for women--although a boyfriend style women's watch cost much more than this one. Plus women's watches don't have the lighted dial which is especially great when you are at a movie or concert.
customer_reviews.author: V Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Best Watch I’ve Ever Had
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one of these watches. It says it’s for a man, but the band is perfect for my wrist. The numbers are easy to read, and the second hand is helpful. The leather band broke on the one I bought about 5 years ago. The battery is still going. It was less expensive to just get a new watch. The crystal is very tough. I wear the face toward the inside of my wrist; so, it takes a beating. Neither one has cracked yet. Ignore the date feature...I never did figure out to set it, and it’s too small to read, anyway. Great value, reliable, and attractive.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch for the Price
customer_reviews.text: I really like this watch. For one thing, I can actually read the face so I know what time it is without having to adjust the distance of my wrist or that it has a light that enables you to maneuver the button on the side, so the face lights up to a warm glow green for night time checks. The face of the watch doesn't seem to me to be the actual size of a man's watch (it's more on the large ladies size to me), but that doesn't detract from the good looks of the timepiece in any way. Price isn't bad either. I've always loved Timex.
customer_reviews.author: Linda J. Jenkins

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after five weeks
customer_reviews.text: My son really likes this watch, so I will have to order another one. It will be the third, over a few months, as the first stopped working and the second fell apart after five weeks. Amazon said I had to go through Timex. Timex had me send it back, with a check for return shipping (Amazon covered), but it will take 2-4 weeks for them to fix it and then more time to mail back. There is a one year warranty, but this watch is of very poor quality. Amazon should have sent another instead of having me wait a month to repair a watch, with a one year warranty, that my son has had for only five weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: This is my favorite men's watch
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite men's watch. I am a female, and always buy watches that have large faces, and this model is always reliable, and Timex watches are always perfect for me. This is my second version of this watch, as my other version does not have a date display. One of the great features is the cool, light , Blue light for thoes times when your in the dark, and you want to know what time is it. I love it! It's simple, and easy to read the numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Tallen

customer_reviews.title: Classic and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying what I would call disposable cheap watches for years. Recently they are not as durable as in the past. Decided to get a STURDY reliable watch. Timex is a timeless name. My purchase exceeded expectations. The design is simple. It is easy to read for elderly (like me). The light feature is a must have. Calendar nos are too small to read easily. Be sure to decide if the size of the face is what you want.
customer_reviews.author: Chicago60624

customer_reviews.title: Great Watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch outperformed my Rolex Watch that costs me $8,000.00. It is the best F...ing watch I ever owned in my life. I had another Timex like this one that was 50 years old. Never missed a minute.
customer_reviews.author: Tornado

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, classic, cheap watch.
customer_reviews.text: It's just perfect. Irritating UI engineering complication (as with cheap Timex models): The date display runs to 31 days, regardless of the month. That means 5 (4?) months out of the year you'll have to rotate the dial forward two full revolutions. Second hand not as loud as the Timex Weekender (another beautiful watch) but still the loudest thing in any silent room.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan

customer_reviews.title: Great timepiece, great price, but a little loud.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Timex because of the reputation of the Timex timepieces and I have not been disappointed. As one or two other reviewers have mentioned, it does have an audible "tick, tick, tick" sound but no so much to annoy me--except when I am trying to sleep. I have to put the watch in a drawer or it will keep me from falling asleep. It keeps great time and I am happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin Coleman Jr

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Watch!
customer_reviews.text: My favorite watch! I like well-made, durable, BASIC stuff: Levi's 501s, Brooks Brothers button-downs, Bass Weejuns, and a TIMEX watch. They last forever, look great, the face lights up, they're waterproof, and they cost almost nothing. I'm on my second one in 15 years! I replace the leather Watchbands with a cloth ribbon band (army surplus) and change it out when it gets ragged. This allows me to shower, swim, workout and sleep while wearing this watch. I NEVER HAVE TO TAKE IT OFF (so I never do)! If you like good, traditional, basic goods, PLEASE... BUY A TIMEX!
customer_reviews.author: Mrchuck2000

customer_reviews.title: Reliable time piece
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model 3-4 years ago and it would still be running if I had figured out how to replace the battery. Less expensive to replace the watch than to chase around for a jeweler to replace the battery. Very sturdy and reliable time piece. I recommend the model with only the date window and not the day and date windows; I found it to adjust the day.
customer_reviews.author: rBravo

customer_reviews.title: Best watch that I have purchased in four years.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second identical watch that I have purchased within the past four years. This is the first watch that the indigo night light has worked consistently for 4 years. The only thing that I have done during this time was replace the battery once, and replace the leather band twice. If the winding stem had not eroded, I would still have the original watch,. This is a great every day watch. Looks good with a large dial, and calendar.
customer_reviews.author: Ida McCarty

customer_reviews.title: they are a fine watch for the price of just under thirty dollars
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these indiglow timexs with big numbers on the face for people with close vision defishencies . they are a fine watch for the price of just under thirty dollars. I'm putting a hundred dollar Indian braclet on mine. The ideglo feature where you push in the stem and the face lights up in the dark si a feature you can't get on a Rolex. I wish this watch was available with a stainless steal case and stem. I'd gladly pay a hundred for it For it's cost I don't think any other watch can touch it.
customer_reviews.author: gary w petersen

customer_reviews.title: The watch fits well and has a nice simple look to it BUT I have only owned ...
customer_reviews.text: The watch fits well and has a nice simple look to it BUT I have only owned it less than 3 weeks and it has stopped a couple of times and I had to reset the time and wind again.Hopefully it will continue to work from this point forward. Well the watch has stopped working 4 different times in 14 days and it is not a dead battery. How annoying and I guess I am returning this watch immediately since I like to have the correct time all of the time and never had an issue like this.
customer_reviews.author: thomas jasak

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing this model for years. I am hard on watches and my old was was pretty scratched up. It was working just fine, thank you, until I tried the change the battery myself. I ruined the watch trying to press the back on. : ( But now I have a nice shiny new one with an unscratched crystal. : ) What more can I say!
customer_reviews.author: makoola

customer_reviews.title: Simple watch
customer_reviews.text: Watch was as described; if I had not read the reviews and questions, I would have not known how to set the time and date and turn on the built-in light. It does come with very detailed information about the warranty (in many languages). Nice big numbers and hands, strap (only part made in China) is of good quality and is of a more than adequate size. I like it and the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Haberman

customer_reviews.title: Fine Watch!
customer_reviews.text: I like this watch. I have worn one of these for many years. It is low cost, keeps perfect time, very easy to read looks fine on my wrist and is and basically trouble free. It does everything a watch needs to do and does it well. At the price, it is unbeatable as a bargain. Shipping was very fast too.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Meisel

customer_reviews.title: Stem Failure
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing the watch and removing it from the overly complicated packaging I carefully nudged the stem out to set the time and date. The stem came lose and pulled out completely. Pushed it back in, set the time and didn't bother with the date since it's too small to read anyway. So far it has stayed in the watch but I'll wait for the one year warranty to see if it holds. Have to have a leather band and they usually fail and are impossible to replace long before the battery goes dead.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Crawford

customer_reviews.title: No manual or instructions
customer_reviews.text: Great looking watch, the leather strap is really a nice touch. Easy to read except for the date due to the very small window. I have a small wrist, and the diameter of the watch is just right, also I like that it is thin. Without instructions, it takes awhile to figure out the settings. The questions and answers on Amazon were a real help.
customer_reviews.author: ouraydog

customer_reviews.title: Very nice.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for a family member. He really loves it. I took the initiative to set the time and date. I found it a bit cumbersome to get it all aligned properly in order to do so. But once I finally figured it out it is working out very well. The Indiglo light feature is very nice and makes it easy to see the time in the dark. It's a very handsome looking watch.
customer_reviews.author: ABC_Easy_As_123

customer_reviews.title: Stiff band
customer_reviews.text: i orderd this watch for my 91 yearold grandfather as he has macular degeneration and cant see well as he could anyway he can tell the time but can not see the date and when we recived it the band was so stiff it chafed and was dificut to fasten and unfasten but its been a month or two so fsr so good.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Quality and value
customer_reviews.text: Have always preferred Timex for quality and value. This time wanted easy to read, day/date, luminous disk with buckle strap. This one fits the bill just fine. This is my first leather strap and it is flexible enough out of the box although I am hoping it will soften even more with wear. I deducted a star because I was unable to correct the day setting without having to swing it through 72 hours, which seems a cumbersome option. Although this is listed as a men's watch, I find it still nicely scaled for women's sports wear.
customer_reviews.author: Barb L

customer_reviews.title: This was truly the Easy Reader watch I was looking for for my 92 year old Dad!
customer_reviews.text: My 92 year ol father has macular degeneration but says one eye that has 20/40 vision sees best with a white background and vivid black lettering. This is exactly what he needed! He was using a flashlight to look at his watches at night until I showed him the easy backlighting. That was a big plus.
customer_reviews.author: rditt

customer_reviews.title: great basic watch
customer_reviews.text: This watch is exactly what I am looking for in a watch. It tells accurate time and is easy to read even at night with the strong back-light feature. I find its simplicity attractive. Its size is just right...easy to read but not so big as to draw attention to itself. I have owned 3 or 4 of these basic Timex watches and they usually last about 3 to 5 years. I get a few battery changes from each one and then something happens when I am changing the battery and they quit working. At the price I don't mind having to get another one.
customer_reviews.author: RUSSELL J. Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great watch! My husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: This is the first watch I have ever purchased for my husband so I was nervous but he absolutely loves it!! It is very easy to set the time and date, it also has a light up feature so when it is too dark but you need to know the time you can just push the knob on the side all the way in and it lights up the watch face. Very nice quality leather band. My husband also wore it into the hot tub and after around 5 minutes of being underwater he noticed and took it off but it still works perfectly!! Very very happy with this watch!!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren J

customer_reviews.title: Everyday utility
customer_reviews.text: This is your minimalist, light in weight, good-value wristwatch--with date function. The uncluttered face is a neutral cream in color and hands are black, making it easy to read the time. This watch pairs with the T2H331 women's model. Good value here.
customer_reviews.author: John O.

customer_reviews.title: Timex redux
customer_reviews.text: Great simple watch. Haven't seen the glow in the dark light yet, but haven't looked for it (take watch off at night). Stylish, harkens back to the era of real watches. Very attractive price. Timex is an iconic brand. Similar watches with obscure names lack the same appeal.
customer_reviews.author: James J. Stark

customer_reviews.title: Terrific watch!
customer_reviews.text: Love the watch! It's so easy to read. I wanted to make it look a bit more feminine, so I purchased a replacement band in pink and have been wearing this every day. It is large enough that I can see my watch again! I kept the original band as it's very nice and can give this to my husband later if I have cataract surgery done. Until then, it really is great.
customer_reviews.author: Renee' M.

customer_reviews.title: it keeps very good time. i rarely have to reset it
customer_reviews.text: i've had this for some time now and it takes a licking and keeps on ticking, as the old advertising slogan used to say. it keeps very good time. i rarely have to reset it, and when i do, it's only for a minute or two. it glows in the dark when you press the hour and minute reset button. i've had it for at least a year, maybe more, and it works perfectly every time. this is a solid purchase that i'm quite happy with. the display is large and clear and i can usually tell the time even without my reading glasses. perfect for what i need. good job timex.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: Good watch, but difficult to read for anyone with vision issues.
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift for 70+ year-old man, who has less-than-great eyesight. Timex has always been a trusted brand for him. The indigo light doesn't seem as bright as it used to be, years back, but it helps a bit. The date feature is barely readable, as the little window is much too small, and you can't really see the whole number. But as long as he can see the time, he's satisfied. A watch with a larger face would be much better for anyone with any vision issues.
customer_reviews.author: TheWelshmansWife

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch because of the reviews and price. I had incredibly low expectations coming in, but was pleasantly surprised for the first few days. Although the watch looks cheap, it was comfortable and ran great. I just wanted something that I could take to Europe and care less about so this was perfect. Today I noticed it was about five minutes slow and adjusted it. A few hours later I noticed AGAIN it was five minutes slow. A lot of people have good luck with them but I didn't, I guess that's the crapshoot of a $20 watch. If I were you, I'd just spend the extra $60 and get something that was accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Fairchild

customer_reviews.title: A highly dependable timepiece
customer_reviews.text: Timex's simplicity and endurance cannot be matched. I live in an independence living facility and because of Covid we cannot go to stores so I purchased the Timex through Amazon. I needed a new watch since my two, more expensive watches both needed battery replacement. I was without a watch so I looked into my brother's jewelry box (He passed away over 4 years ago) and found an old Timex. It has not been warn for over 4 years and looked quite old. Surprise, it worked fine. When you need dependability, you can't beat Timex. And the price is always reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: Vern

customer_reviews.title: Great watch- buy it!’
customer_reviews.text: Nust received this watch right on time. I am a woman/nurse. Nice large easy read face, it is not too large for a woman’s wrist. It is perfect. Night light easy to read and just push the button. Black leather watchband is good quality. Highly recommend you buy this watch.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Campbell-Skelly

customer_reviews.title: Takes a licking and keeps on ticking!
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying this wonderful Indiglo watch for many years. Great watch! There is a button that lights up the face--discreetly-- so you can check the time in a movie theater without disturbing anybody. It has a large face, so it's easy to see. Today it fell into the dog's water bowl and once rescued, it just ticked away as usual. I buy the men's watch because they have the large faces and they don't always have what I want in the unisex line.
customer_reviews.author: Virtually

customer_reviews.title: SOLID DEPENDABLE TIMEPIECE!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent watch. Exactly what I wanted. Easy to read numbers. The Indiglo feature I could not do without and it keeps very accurate time. I had the same watch previously in a silver tone and had good service from it for ten years. The only problem I had was after changing the battery I could not get the top back on. Had to take it to a jeweler and they left scratches on the back trying to get it back on. Hopefully it won't happen with this watch. Looking forward to many years of high performance and long battery life. It is a very good looking basic watch.
customer_reviews.author: CRITIC AT LARGE

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as promised and in new condition. I like the size and easily read numbers. The band was too small and I have already replaced. The date is quite small and does not keep accurate pace with the actual date. I like the watch and was happy with the very reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Battery died after a couple of weeks!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this watch because the battery on my watch died and during this pandemic, I can’t get it replaced. Nice watch and inexpensive but...the battery died on this one about 2 weeks in...very disappointing! I’m in isolation...can’t send it back. Really ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Tracey

customer_reviews.title: Great, Classic Watch
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking watch that looks like it cost at least twice as much. The only issue is I wish the face was a few mm larger to fit with current trends. Not that it needs to be huge, but there isn't much in the mens watch market that isn't a few mm larger.
customer_reviews.author: DCAVFB

customer_reviews.title: It is still ticking
customer_reviews.text: My better half has not managed to destroy this watch. I do keep it home when we go to the hospital. I got this when the price was really good, so I am very happy with this purchase. Timex still holds up. I do not like the band, but, it is still a good watch.
customer_reviews.author: elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: This watch is great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this watch for my husband to replace his previous timex. He is very pleased with both the watch and the watchband as he says it is much more comfortable than his old one. The watch keeps excellent time and date and is very easy to read. We highly recommend timex indiglo.
customer_reviews.author: msl

customer_reviews.title: Good basic model
customer_reviews.text: On my third one in the last 15 years. My only complaint is the gold finish erodes on the underside edges from body perspiration & becomes rough on the skin after 5 or 6 years. UPDATE: Quit after 10 months. I assumed it was a battery, so I replaced it. It runs but it loses 15-20 minutes per day. It's clearly defective & still under warranty, but it's not worth the hassle to return it with an $8.00 check & proof of purchase, & then probably wait a month to get it back.
customer_reviews.author: Freestyle Freddy

customer_reviews.title: Wearing as we speak...
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for. I have vision that changes frequently. Cataracts, far/near problems. This watch works for those who want to see what time it is one the wrist. Staying on time thus far. BC
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Setting and reading the date!
customer_reviews.text: I like the numbers. It is very good when looking at the time. In that respect it is easy to read. The problems I have with the watch is looking at the date. It is so small that I can hardly read it without a magnifying glass. The other problem is setting the date is hard to get the stem into the right position to adjust the date. Also no instructions came with to know how to set the date.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S

customer_reviews.title: Didnt even take a licking , and it fell apart🙁
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy , when i bought, and received this watch. The watchband pin popped out. I didn't have the watch a month. I went to the mall for a new pin. That one also popped. Not sure why , but it looks like the tiny hole that was milled is too tiny for the pin. I am very sad , and disappointed . How can i return this.
customer_reviews.author: Nv

customer_reviews.title: "Easy Reader Date," NOT
customer_reviews.text: The dial is as expected, easy to read. However, I would have thought the engineers on the project would expect people who need a large-print dial would need an "easy reader" date. I doubt that a person with 20/20 would find reading the date "easy." The band also disconnected after a month or two. Disappointed. The watch does keep time, on my dresser.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Mckenzie

customer_reviews.title: LOVE ITTTTT!
customer_reviews.text: I have very small wrists, and this watch size looks amazing on my wrist. I still needed a 1.5mm hole punch to make the wrist band fit snuggly, so if you have thin wrists, you might need to get that tool as well. Get the hole punch tool that actually punches out a hole when tapped down with a hammer.
customer_reviews.author: Duy H. Luu

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read time but date is a bit small for my aging eyes. Medium size case. Band is quite stiff at this new point but may relax with time. Hopefully that will lead to longer band life than a lot of leather or fabric bands I've had.
customer_reviews.author: buyer1

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read Wrist Watch
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read except the day of the month ! The leather Band is a little stiff ! Otherwise a great Buy !
customer_reviews.author: Stewart Chalamidas M.D. a humble Student of the Course in Miracles.

customer_reviews.title: Initial reaction
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time today. The watch looks exactly like it does in the picture. It is a neat looking and inexpensive watch and I will be quite satisfied if it keeps accurate time and lasts at least one year. There is not much downside risk in buying this and I will update in a couple of months only if it tarnishes or the time keeping is inaccurate
customer_reviews.author: Srikanth

customer_reviews.title: Sizing
customer_reviews.text: Just FYI...the band is not adjustable and was too big for my dad's wrist. He is on the slight side - so this shouldn't be a universal problem. Otherwise it is a very nice watch and he liked it very much
customer_reviews.author: LakeDesert

customer_reviews.title: Awful!!
customer_reviews.text: Awful experience. The watch arrived and it's completely dead. On top of that, this is clearly not a man's watch. The face is tiny and the band barely makes it around my wrist (and I have small wrists). It looks absurd. This is not what I expect from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: L.J. Sosa

customer_reviews.title: Love the watch...with one caveat.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderfully accurate. Easy to read. Love the leather band. Bright and friendly presentation. Only thing I'd change: I WOULD NOT get the date feature. The crown was simply too difficult to pull out to the second click to adjust the date - in fact I damaged the watch trying. The first click, for adjusting the time, was fine. Now that the watch is damaged, the time adjustment is a bit squirrely. Fortunately the watch is so accurate that I hardly ever have to make an adjustment. This is my favorite watch to wear even though it's one of the cheapest.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Simple classic (and loud) watch
customer_reviews.text: The good: -Simple watch that matches when you dress in a simple, classic way. -Great price -Great build quality -Looks sleek The bad: -This watch is LOUD I have it on my wrist now as I type and the display is facing me. I can clearly hear the ticking. -It might not look good if you have big hairy sailor arms. Regardless I totally recommend it if you want a simple cheap but good looking watch! Other: Other users complain about the lighting not covering the whole display. That is really not an issue as it is only a minimal part of the bottom of the display and I rarely use that function anyway.
customer_reviews.author: End of silence

customer_reviews.title: Good watch with indigo light
customer_reviews.text: I am pleased overall with this watch. I like the slightly larger dial and excellent quality leather strap. I do find that the day window is really really small and as such it isn't of much use. I love the Timex Indiglo Light-up feature watches and have had them for many years. Good quality watch at an excellent price.
customer_reviews.author: George E. Goff & Better Half MicheleTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Nice watch
customer_reviews.text: It's a timex... it takes a licken' and keeps on ticken'. Perfect size for easy reading. Like the glowing face and that it has the date. Only issue is when trying to set the date, getting the stem to pull out just to the first stop is really tough and takes a few tries. Good choice for an inexpensive watch.
customer_reviews.author: DLT

customer_reviews.title: Quality affordable watch
customer_reviews.text: Arrive date promised. Packaged well. I’m a senior woman with large wrist and diminishing vision. Watch comfortable to wear and easy to read. Love dial light. Wanted affordable quality practical watch. Recommend and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Iowa RN
